document_data.name: Finara
document_data.basicrefs: {{cite book/Plague of Spells|201-206|14}}{{cite book/Forgotten Realms Campaign Guide|193}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Finara''' was a [[Scar Pilgrimage|spellscar pilgrim]]. In {{yearlink|1396}}, she joined [[Raidon Kane]] and [[Hadyn]] in a pilgrimage to the Spellscarred land near [[Ormpetarr]]; after Hadyn's death, she backed down, and became both a member of the [[Order of Blue Fire]] and an innkeeper.{{cite book/Plague of Spells|221-225|16}}
document_data.Description: In {{yearlink|1396}}, she was gray-haired. By {{yearlink|1479}}, she was elderly.
document_data.Personality: Finara was initially resolute to learn the ways of magic again after the collapse of ''[[the Weave]]'', or die trying. However, confronted with a dying comrade, she chose to limit the risks.
document_data.Abilities: Finara had been a mage before the [[Spellplague]].
document_data.Possessions: Before the Spellplague, Finara had a tower. Afterwards, by {{yearlink|1396}}, she owned a [[burro]] by the time she arrived at Ormpetarr.
document_data.Activities: By {{yearlink|1479}}, Finara was the owner of [[Finara's]], an inn in Ormpetarr, and a fringe member of the [[Order of Blue Fire]].
document_data.History:
Before the Spellplague, Finara had been a mage, living in a tower; she proved unable to grasp the new make of spells after the Spellplague. Determined to regain her magic or die trying, she headed for Ormpetarr, looking to acquire a spellscar of her own. There, she joined Hadyn and Raidon Kane at some point in {{yearlink|1396}} in a trip into the Spellscarred Land, where she brought her burro.

They followed the [[Pilgrim's Path]] across the [[Granite Vortex]], deciding to cross the bridge that led through it. When Hadyn was slain by the spellscarred land, she decided not to finish the trip, and went back with her burro; only Raidon Kane persevered. By {{yearlink|1479}}, she had made it back to Ormpetarr, where she opened an inn, Finara's.
